aBMFinal

Class Firms

  • java.lang.Object
    • aBMFinal.Firms

  • public class Firms
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Firms is used for all firms in the model.
    Author:
    Hackett, Avalos, Morales

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double averageSalariesFirm()
      This method computes the average salaries paid by a firm to its workers
      void fireAll()
      This method first clears the list of past workers of the firm (they retire), then current workers are moved onto past workers and we clear current workers to make space for the next generation of employees.

      This method searches over workers and chooses the employees based on their value from valIndividual.

    • Method Detail

      • numberAcquaintance

        public float numberAcquaintance(aBMFinal.Individual i)
        Returns the number of employees that a prospective employee "knows" at the firm.
        Returns:
        float

      • valIndividual

        public double valIndividual(aBMFinal.Individual i)
        Assigns a numeric value to a prospective employee based on expected talent and connections. This number is used to rank and hire employees. Note: valuation is done in reverse numbers (most valuable worker has the smallest value) so to make easier the sorting of workers.
        Returns:
        double

      • sortHashMapByValues

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<aBMFinal.Individual,java.lang.Double> sortHashMapByValues(java.util.HashMap<aBMFinal.Individual,java.lang.Double> passedMap)
        This method is used to sort, in descending order, a HashMap according to its (numeric) values.
        Returns:
        LinkedHashMap

      • hireWorkers

        public void hireWorkers()
        This method searches over workers and chooses the employees based on their value from valIndividual. The available prospects with the highest values are chosen, then taken out from consideration for the rest of the firms hiring process.

      • paySalary

        public void paySalary()
        This method adds the mark up times 1000 onto each worker's believed talent to its wealth. Note: since valIndividual was made negative to sort workers, we take minus this values. Note: We multiply the mark up times 1000 to make it relevant in terms of average wealth.

      • averageSalariesFirm

        public double averageSalariesFirm()
        This method computes the average salaries paid by a firm to its workers
        Returns:
        double

      • fireAll

        public void fireAll()
        This method first clears the list of past workers of the firm (they retire), then current workers are moved onto past workers and we clear current workers to make space for the next generation of employees.
